title: Bug 394234Invalid StackMapTable generated in Java 7
description: When compiling for Java 7, AspectJ can compute an invalid StackMapTable. The verifier will throw a ClassNotFoundException when the generated class is loaded.Example:class Parent<T {}class ChildA<T extends Parent<T {}class ChildB<T extends Parent<T {}public Object methodWithBadStackMapTable(boolean value) {return value ? new ChildA<String() : new ChildB<String();}javap shows the computed StackMapTable to be:StackMapTable: numberofentries = 2frametype = 15 / same /frametype = 71 / samelocals1stackitem /stack = [ class "Parent<T" ]when it should be:StackMapTable: numberofentries = 2frametype = 15 / same /frametype = 71 / samelocals1stackitem /stack = [ class Parent ]
